source_id: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_025_chunk1
evidence_span: Oxidation rate data for Zircaloy-4 in steam under isothermal conditions in the temperature range 1000 to 1500°C indicate that the kinetics of layer growth and oxygen consumption can be described by virtually ideal parabolic behavior.

source_id: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_025_chunk1
evidence_span: We have measured the oxidation rate of pure, arc-melted, crystal-bar zirconium under similar conditions and have found differences in the reaction characteristics compared with Zircaloy-4.

source_id: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_025_chunk1
evidence_span: At temperatures from 1098 to 1416°C, while parabolic kinetics are still observed, the growth rates for both phases are measurably different.

source_id: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_025_chunk1
evidence_span: In addition to the decreased oxygen diffusivity in the oxide phase on pure zirconium compared with that on Zircaloy-4, a higher activation energy was also observed

source_id: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_025_chunk1
evidence_span: a higher activation energy was also observed

evidence_span: Specimens of zirconium were machined from arc-melted crystal-bar stock in the form of cylindrical tubes 3 cm long, 1.1 cm in diameter, with a wall thickness of 0.075 cm
